meanings.definition: To drink greedily or in large quantities.
meanings.sent1: The thirsty dog guzzled the water from his bowl.
meanings.sent2: After playing outside, the children guzzled their juice boxes.
meanings.sent3: The baby guzzled his milk so fast, he got a milk mustache!
meanings.sent4: She guzzled knowledge from books like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The hiker guzzled the refreshing stream water to quench his thirst.

meanings.sent1: The students guzzled the information in the lecture.
meanings.sent2: The moviegoers guzzled their popcorn during the film.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel guzzled the nuts like it was preparing for winter.
meanings.sent4: Time guzzled away as she lost herself in the captivating novel.
meanings.sent5: The fans guzzled the excitement of the game as their team scored the winning goal.
